name: Record Retention and Cutoff Dates
description: Compliance with retention rules and exception for drafts/duplicates

theory.natural_language: According to the retention schedule, financial records must be retained for seven years. Tax filings are financial records. Invoices are financial records. Chat logs are not financial records. Draft documents that were never issued are excluded from retention. Certified copies count as originals.

queries.natural_language: Should we keep the invoice from fiscal year 2018 until at least 2025?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Invoices are financial records retained for seven years, so an invoice from 2018 stays until 2025.

queries.natural_language: Do informal chat logs fall under the seven-year retention?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Chat logs are not financial records and are not covered by the seven-year rule.

queries.natural_language: Must an unsigned draft policy be archived like the final version?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Draft documents that were never issued are excluded from retention.
